result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony L. Nesbit Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit Jr. in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Anthony L. Nesbit Jr.  Attorney Patrick Anderson in court on behalf of Alexander James Geocaris for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests a resolution date. Court adjourn matter for a plea and sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 9:00 am; court is down October 17, 2022.  Parties agreed to new status conference date, via email.  Status conference adjourned for October 18, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has a pending matter in Branch 30 set for jury trial on 10/10/2022.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit in court with Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Arraignment held.
Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. 

Defense counsel advises Court that he needs to investigate whether there was a conviction in the State of Illinois.

Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated May 19, 2022 - received

Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony L. Nesbit appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of defendant's prior OWI convictions on 08/25/2005, 11/22/2016, and defendant's pending case regarding case 20CT1202. Sworn for the State: P.O. Chris Moglia - Greenfield P.D.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed; defense requests an arraignment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated April 14, 2022 - received
JusticePoint Status Report dated March 30, 2022 - received

Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is on standby. Attorney Rosenthal to be appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
    99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated March 17, 2022 - received

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Anthony L. Nesbit in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony L. Nesbit appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2-5.

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/
     99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
